column31: I have a grandson who is half puerto rican, not that I was a bigot prior to that, so I would like to say I support the paper's recent efforts to reach all of our community inclusively. We have a large hispanic population and imo this effort is somewhat overdue so I hope it continues as well as the paper hiring so-called "minorities." I remember not all that long ago all the reporters and editors being white and non-hispanic. Nice to see talented young people of all races and ethnicities being hired by the paper and I hope it continues.

column5: Articles concerning the Latino experience, history and citizen status of Puerto Ricans. Too many Americans don't have knowledge about the status  history, even after 124 years. Why isn't this taught in school? Orville H. Platt was involved in acquiring PR from Spain after the Spanish American war.  Meriden named a high school after him. Why isn't this connection known locally?
